For all-inclusive news coverage please follow Zee Kannada News content across all platforms.

title: Why India‚Äôs Waste-to-Energy Plants are Failing!
description:
Waste-to-Energy (WtE) plants are being pitched as India‚Äôs big solution to overflowing landfills. Burning trash to create power. But across Delhi, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and other cities, these plants are failing and sparking massive citizen protests.

In this video, we break down:
How WtE plants work
Why Indian waste isn‚Äôt suitable for incineration
The health and environmental risks
The huge financial burden on cities
How these plants undermine recycling and waste pickers‚Äô livelihoods
Instead of solving our waste crisis, WtE is creating new ones. Watch to understand why.

Music:
Slow life - https://www.bensound.com/free-music-for-videos
Melodic techno-https://pixabay.com/music/techno-trance-melodic-techno-03-extended-version-moogify-9867/

title: Bengaluru   Bannerghatta Video Story
description:
The National Highways Authority of India is planning to build a four lane expressway through the Bannerghatta National Park. Bannerghatta is a protected area south of Bengaluru and is home to several endangered mammals and birds. The protected area is an important link in a large Elephant corridor and is also home to two tigers, making Bengaluru the only city in the world with wild tigers. Bhanu Sridharan reports on what is at stake with the project.

https://bit.ly/3Ug9LwK

title: "Bengaluru can co-exist with Leopards, wildlife" - Dr Sanjay Gubbi
description:
What can citizens learn from the recent leopard forays into Bengaluru. Senior Wildlife biologist Dr Sanjay Gubbi explains why large mammals sometimes enter Bengaluru, what citizens should do in these cases and how we can coexist with wildfire in our city.  

Dr Sanjay Gubbi is a wildlife biologist and conservationist. His work focuses on the conservation of large carnivores like tigers and leopards, working on applied aspects and understanding their population biology, proposing conservation policies for their protection. He is the founder of the Holematthi Nature Foundation.

title: Citizen Matters Webinar: Why not public transport?
description:
What stops Bengalureans from choosing buses and metro over cars and bikes and how this can change.

Everyday, around 40 lakh passengers use the bus and about five lakh people travel by Namma Metro. Yet, there is some hesitancy, in Bengaluru, to choose buses and metro over cars and bikes. To understand why this is the case and how it can change, Citizen Matters, Bengaluru, organised a webinar ‚ÄòWhy not public transport?‚Äô

https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/public-transport-cars-bikes-metro-bus-dult-bmtc-bmrcl-123112 

Video by: Harshitha Padmavinod
The panellists :Srinivas Alavilli, Fellow, Integrated Transport and Road Safety, World Resources Institute (WRI) India 
Shreya Satish Mokhashi, Assistant Urban Planner at Directorate of Urban Land Transport (DULT)  
Jayenkumar Desai, Head of Strategy and Transformation VMware Software India Pvt Ltd  Lalithamba BV, a citizen of Bengaluru and an advocate of sustainable transport  
Meera K, Trustee Oorvani Foundation, - moderator.

title: Citizen Matters panel discussion | Missing: Public participation in lake development in Bengaluru
CM Bengaluru Webinar - Changemakers: Lessons from the 25-year journey of Environment Support Group
CM Bengaluru- Webinar - The mysterious process of budget allocations
description:
It was recently reported  that Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) had received over Rs 28,000 crore in the past six years. The state government sanctioned over Rs 8,000 crore in 2022-2023 alone. Over 60% of this money has been spent on road works, including flyovers and underpasses. Of the Rs 8, 000 crore sanctioned last year, Rs 6,000 crore is being spent on road works. BBMP has issued work orders for this Rs 6,000 crore in one go, even though the money is meant to be spent over three years. 

To discuss these issues, Bengaluru Citizen Matters is organising a webinar, titled ‚ÄòThe mysterious process of Bengaluru‚Äôs budget allocations‚Äô.

title: Webinar - Living with Metro: Addressing safety concerns
description: In a tragic incident in early January, a mother and her two-year old son passed away when an under construction metro pillar reinforcement structure in Outer Ring Road (ORR), near HBR Layout, collapsed on them. This led to righteous outrage among citizens. Questions were raised not only about safety at the metro construction site but also of the roads in front of the Metro stations. How safe is it to cross the road to walk to the Metro stations? How challenging is it to commute to metro stations?

title: Regulating Bengaluru Traffic. In Conversation with M.A. Saleem IPS, Special Commissioner of Police.
description: M.A. Saleem speaks to Citizen Matters about ITMS and other technologies used in controlling traffic and ensuring pedestrian safety.

title: Online discussion | Lessons from Church Street: 5 years hence, what worked and what didn‚Äôt
description: Instead of asking, ‚ÄúWhy Church Street/CBD‚Äù, frame the proposition as a constructive, solutions oriented discussion: What worked in Church Street, What needs to improve (both in terms of the process and implementation) and what future road projects in the city can take away from the exercise.

title: Alexa, water the plants! How this techie rigged a remote controlled garden watering system
description:
"Not surprisingly, gardening is probably the most common hobby in Namma Bengaluru, which truly was a ‚Äògarden city‚Äô when I first came here in 1997," says Srinivasulu Nasam. However, over the last two decades, we have all been witness to much of that garden space being taken over by concrete. But we Bengalureans still have that in our DNA, to grow plants wherever we live, whether on the 10th floor of an apartment, in a good old typical Bengaluru house in Jayanagar or in a housing community with individual houses.

In this video, learn more about Srinivasulu Nasam's automated drip watering system for his terrace garden in Bengaluru.

More details: https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/

_____________________________________________________

Video credit: Srinivasulu Nasam

title: Land snails, an indicator of pollution
description:
Bengaluru Biodiversity Charche, organised on Saturday, September 18th, was a day-long celebration of the biodiversity of the garden city. It brought together thinkers, activists, journalists and students to explore questions surrounding urban biodiversity, threats faced by various species and how these issues could be brought to light.

The event is a culmination of the work Citizen Matters did on the topic over the past year, in collaboration with the environment and conservation magazine Mongabay-India, supported by grants from the Bengaluru Sustainability Forum.

This is a video shot by Shradha Suman, one of the best entries from the 'Biodiversity in My Bengaluru Backyard' contest announced during the event. Below is the description of Shradha's observations: 

Snails were spotted in moist soil conditions near a plant in my garden.  It intrigued me as to how can a snail be found in urban polluted conditions. Later I researched and prepared the report as given below. Land snails are important to the ecosystem. They are found low on the food web, as most land snails feed on rotting vegetation like moist leaf litter, fungi and soil directly. This gives calcium and other nutrients for the formation of shells and embryos. Gilled snails depend on high concentrations of dissolved oxygen, making them sensitive to pollution. As land snails do not rely directly on dissolved oxygen for respiration (breathing), they are generally more tolerant of polluted conditions. Snails act as biological tools used by researchers to enumerate soil pollution, identify or predict damage to ecosystems and monitor the evolution of pollution in time and space. This gastropod is known for its ability to concentrate pollutant substances (such as metallic trace elements) in its tissues, making it possible to analyse the toxic element. Smaller shell size is an indicator of inferior growth of snails in heavily polluted areas. Pollution affects diversity, abundance (available shell mass) and individual quality of land snails, posing reproductive problems for birds that rely on snails as calcium sources during breeding.

Video credit: Shradha Suman
Thumbnail credit: Gaurav Sawant

Read more about the event and contest: https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/bengaluru-biodiversity-charche-event-lakes-flora-fauna-bittu-sahgal-67602

title: Bengaluru Namma Neeru Namma Javabdaari
description:
What does it then take to carefully save every possible drop of water and manage the demand to avoid the typical summer worries? To explore and answer these questions, we have experts and individuals alike - officials from Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board, citizens and activists from Bangalore Apartment Federation. 

This is a part of our webinar series on the theme of Water in Bengaluru, whose objective is to engage citizens of Bangalore and inspire them towards water conservation. In the 1st session that happened in July - Catch the Rain, we focused on Harvesting.

title: The school fee issue: What's the best way forward?
description:
Karnataka government had ordered a 30 per cent reduction in school fees. School managements say it is difficult to do that. Parents remain worried. What is the role of the Karnataka government in ensuring children's education is not impacted in this context?

With parents on the one side and school managements on the other, both holding on to diametrically opposite view-points, there is now a deadlock. Both sides have their share of fair arguments. After all, the pandemic has affected every sector and every individual. 

While all eyes are on the State government to resolve the impasse, students, whose education, careers, futures are at stake in this imbroglio, could be the unintended victims.

What can be done to save the situation? How can both parents and schools get a fair deal? And, importantly, what‚Äôs the role of the State in ensuring that children‚Äôs education does not suffer?

On March 5, Citizen Matters organised a panel on ‚ÄúThe school fee issue: What's the best way forward?‚Äú bringing parents, school managements, teachers and government representatives to deliberate a way forward, that ensures our childrens‚Äô education is not compromised. Meera K, Co-Founder of Citizen Matters, set the context of the discussion. 

Panelists: 
‚óè M Madan Gopal ‚Äî Retired Additional Chief Secretary
‚óè Sanjeev Narrain ‚Äî RBANM's Educational Charities
‚óè Kiran Prasad ‚Äî Core Committee member, KAMS
‚óè Chaitra Rudresh ‚Äî Parent
‚óè Sandhya Bhat ‚Äî Citizen Matters (Moderator)

title: Turahalli: Govt‚Äôs mission or civil society‚Äôs vision?
description:
Bengaluru Mission 2022 is the state government‚Äôs plan to transform the city‚Äôs infrastructure, enabling faster commute and providing a cleaner and greener city. It was unveiled by Karnataka Chief Minister BS Yeddiyurappa in December last year.

The proposed plan includes the creation of new urban lung spaces in existing mini forests in and around the city. Going by the Chief Minister‚Äôs tweet, parks/gardens like Cubbon Park and Lalbagh are cited as models for lung spaces.

Bengaluru Mission 2022 envisions turning a natural forest ‚Äî the popular Turahalli forest on Kanakapura Road, south of the city ‚Äî into a tree park. It entails converting 400 acres of the 597-acre scrub and rocky jungle into a public park with ticketed entry. There is, still, no detailed project report that the government has placed in the public domain.

The proposed tree park is expected to have amenities including 10 km of walkways/paths, entry arch, toilets, canteen, parking lot, children‚Äôs play area, senior citizens‚Äô gym, and yoga spaces. 

Is this the need of the hour?

Environmental activists, naturalists, rock-climbing enthusiasts, birders, walkers and residents living close to Turahalli forest have strongly opposed such development. To begin with, they say that the government‚Äôs plan violates Section 2 of the Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980, and several other Supreme Court orders.

They have sought immediate stoppage to the ongoing ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù at Turahalli, and hold the forest department responsible for the violations.

Citizen Matters has invited a diverse panel to discuss the implications of converting this natural habitat ‚Äî complete with its flora, fauna and its own ecosystem ‚Äî into a tree park. At a point in time when the effects of climate change are clearly visible on a day-to-day basis, is it prudent to interfere with one of the last remaining forest patches around Bengaluru?

What role should the government ‚Äî through policy/legislation/enforcement ‚Äî and civil society, play in preserving this unique heritage? 

Also, can we discount the fact that there are no green spaces in the city where people can connect with nature? Should it be conserved as a natural environment and a public space, without turning it into a manicured and ticketed garden?

What is the Turahalli that Bengaluru needs? And, how should that be created? The online panel discussion organised by Citizen Matters was held on February 17, 2021.

Panelists: 
‚óè Sanjai Mohan ‚Äî Principal Chief Conservator of Forests (PCCF)
‚óè Joseph Hoover‚Äî United Conservation Movement
‚óè Bharat ‚Äî Save Turahalli Campaign
‚óè Prakash Belawadi ‚Äî Media personality
‚óè Deepa Mohan ‚Äî Writer and Naturalist
‚óè Leo F Saldanha ‚Äî Environment Support Group
‚óè Meera K ‚Äî Co-Founder, Citizen Matters (Moderator)

Read more about Turahalli:
‚óè Why has the ‚Äòtree park‚Äô plan in Turahalli forest irked Bengaluru? https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/why-has-the-governments-proposed-tree-park-in-turahalli-forest-irked-residents-56607
‚óè Turahalli: Missing the woods for the trees https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/what-efforts-have-been-made-to-conserve-turahalli-56881
‚óè Turahalli: Govt‚Äôs mission or civil society‚Äôs vision? https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/turahalli-panel-discussion-bengaluru-mission-2022-56812

title: Sathya Sankaran | The way forward for Bengaluru's Commuter Rail Project
description:
Bengaluru is one city, without a formal suburban rail system. For years, many commuters have been using passenger trains like the Salem Passenger to commute to/from the city and the outskirts. But a well distributed, dependable Commuter Rail Services (CRS) which could have benefited lakhs of residents living near the railway network already crisscrossing the city. 

The Bengaluru-Kempegowda airport service train started on the existing track, on January 4th. By 2023-24 another line, which is part of the suburban rail project, is to be ready.

It had taken almost 4 decades to get to this point. Can we get the rest of the network in the next 4 years?

On January 16, 2021, Citizen Matters arranged a discussion on Bengaluru‚Äôs Commuter Rail Project CRP with a panel of activists who have been campaigning for a rail-based extension to the suburbs. Sathya Sankaran ‚Äî Praja RAAG shares what citizens should do to ensure there is no more delay in the CRP

title: Implementing a solar rooftop in Bengaluru
description:
An expanding city like Bengaluru consumes over 40 million units of power every day, which is projected to increase to 74 million units by 2030.

The city‚Äôs power utility BESCOM has a target to generate 1200 MW electricity from rooftop solar panels by 2022. BESCOM‚Äôs Renewable Purchase Obligation makes it mandatory for it to purchase a minimum of 8% of its total energy from renewable sources. However, as per the BESCOM‚Äôs July 2019 data, Bengaluru‚Äôs solar rooftop power capacity stood at 205 MW.

Meanwhile, many apartment complexes have taken the lead in embracing sustainable practices and becoming more efficient and self-sufficient.

How can more buildings adopt solar? What steps do they need to follow? MCs of apartments who have been through the process of installing Solar Rooftop answer questions from interested citizens.

Meera K and Ekta Sawant from Citizen Matters along with Sandhya Bhat from Bangalore Apartments' Federation (BAF) speak with a panel of Managing Committee (MC) members who have got their apartments to adopt solar rooftop:

Panelists:
‚óè   Satish Mallya ‚Äî Century Saras
‚óè   Nikhil Grover ‚Äî Brigade Petunia
‚óè   Vishnu Gattupalli ‚Äî President, Trifecta Starlight
‚óè   Vikram Rai ‚Äî General Secretary, BAF
‚óè   Harsha Kuntur ‚Äî Founder & MD Eco Soch
‚óè   Sriparn Saurabh ‚Äî Solar UL
‚óè   Shankar Swaminathan ‚Äî Vice President, BAF

Links to articles on Rooftop Solar published on Citizen Matters:

title: Three decades and counting: How can we speed up Bengaluru's commuter rail project?
description:
Bengaluru is one city, without a formal suburban rail system. For years, many commuters have been using passenger trains like the Salem Passenger to commute to/from the city and the outskirts. But a well distributed, dependable Commuter Rail Services (CRS) which could have benefited lakhs of residents living near the railway network already crisscrossing the city. 

Our 2009 article: Commuter rail plans going nowhere? (https://bengaluru.citizenmatters.in/citizens-demand-suburban-trains-in-bangalore-8843) talked about the back and forth between the State and Railways. Many moons, budgets and announcements have passed by. Finally, in October 2020, the project was approved by the Prime Minister's Office. 

The revised proposal was for 148 km, and 58 stations, with 4 corridors. KSR Bengaluru City to Devanahalli, Baiyappanahalli to Chikkabanavara, Kengeri to Whitefield, Heelalige to Rajanakunte

The Bengaluru-Kempegowda airport service train started on the existing track, on January 4th. By 2023-24 another line, which is part of the suburban rail project, is to be ready.

It had taken almost 4 decades to get to this point. Can we get the rest of the network in the next 4 years?

Meera K and Bhanutej N from Citizen Matters speak with a panel of activists who have been campaigning for a rail based extension to the suburbs:

SILK MARK EXPO 2025, BENGALURU
Bengaluru, December 2025, while celebrating important functions and festivals, women all over India choose to wear Pure Silk ‚Äì the Queen of Textiles. As consumers looking to buy pure silks, it is their right to get 100% pure silk. However, many get cheated by unscrupulous traders selling impure silk which are made up of cheaper options like Viscose Rayon, Polyester, Nylon etc. in the name of pure silk.
Silk Mark Organization of India (SMOI), an initiative of Central Silk Board, Ministry of Textiles, Government of India organizes Silk Mark Expos all over the country to ensure the discerning silk loving consumers get an opportunity to see and buy 100% pure silk products from across India. These expos also provide a platform to the genuine Weavers, Co-operatives, Societies, Women Entrepreneurs, Traders, etc. to showcase and sell their products to consumers who understand the value of pure silk.
The unique feature of these expos is that not only one gets to see a wide variety of silks from numerous silk weaving clusters from across India but also experience and choose from the all 4 types of commercial silks namely Mulberry, Tasar, Eri and Muga. In addition to that, one can be absolutely sure that each and every product being sold at the expo is 100% pure silk assured by the Silk Mark Label. There is also a live Silk Testing Counter at the expo to ensure one is able to test the purity of the silk they purchase instantly absolutely free of cost. 
The theme pavilions of the Silk Mark Organisation of India at the expo attract a lot of attention as they present a glimpse of the sericulture industry with cocoon, yarn and fabric display. Live silk worms exhibited is the centre of attraction. 
The Silk Mark Expo 2025 is scheduled from 4th to 9th December 2025 at Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath, Kumara Krupa Road, Bengaluru. The expo will be open to all from morning 11:00 am till evening 7:00pm during this period.
This expo has around 43  stalls put up by Authorised Users of Silk Mark from all over India covering 08-10 states representing more than 12 silk weaving clusters. It has diversified silk products like Tassar Silk sarees with fancy designs having embroidery with contrast color, Kantha work, Tassar shirts & Jackets, Eri Silk socks, Silk bags, Shirts, Dhotis, Blouses and Garments apart from traditional Kanjivaram, Banarasi, Pochampally, Murshidabad, Mysore Silk, Uppada, Paithani etc., sarees. 
This is a great chance for those looking to purchase pure silk for ensuing weddings in the family, upcoming special occasions and festivals or regular use.

Hon'ble Minister Priyank M. Kharge  inaugurated India's 100kw high power rack solutions @ASSOCHAM 
‚ÄúKarnataka is the only government in the world who has funded over 1,700 startups and more than 28% of all startups registered in the government of Karnataka are deep tech startups. To accelerate startups in deep tech companies, we have announced the next 10 years as a deep tech decade with a pledge of 635 Crores to support Deep Tech.‚Äù said Mr. Priyank M Kharge, Hon'ble Minister, Rural Development and Panchayat Raj & IT & Biotechnology, Government of Karnataka at the 8th ASSOCHAM Smart Datacenters &
Cloud Infrastructure Conclave 2025.  
‚ÄúThe government has a program called Catalyst for global capability centers with dedicated personnels for anybody interested in investing in Karnataka. The program can be expanded to include Data Centers as well. We have also launched the Local Economic Accelerator Program (LEAP) to encourage investments beyond Bangalore so that investments to go where talent is rather than talent coming to the investments. We have India's biggest reskilling and upskilling programme in Karnataka with over 300 crores spendings to ensure that we have the most trained human research for the world. We are going to ensure that Karnataka is going to be energy secure and water secure for energy technology because it is not just an IT agenda or a technology agenda. It is an economic strategy, an employment strategy, a security strategy and more importantly, it is a national development strategy for us.‚Äù The Minister added.
 
During the event Hon‚Äôble Minister Priyank M. Kharge e-launches Bengaluru‚Äôs Largest Data Center Campus by NTT at Devenhalli. The 8.5-acre campus delivers 100 MW facility load, with Bengaluru 4A ready for commissioning at 22.4 MW. With a 220 kV dedicated substation, IGBC Platinum rating, renewable integration and advanced security, the campus strengthens Karnataka‚Äôs position as a sustainable, AI-ready digital infrastructure hub.
 
The global digital infrastructure sector is expanding quickly, with data centre capacity expected to exceed 2,300 facilities by 2026 and investments crossing USD 400 billion by 2030. India is one of the fastest-growing markets, projected to attract USD 10‚Äì12 billion by 2030. Karnataka leads this growth with strong tech talent, progressive policies and expansion into Tier-2/3 cities. Launched during the conclave the ASSOCHAM‚ÄìPwC report, ‚ÄúHeading Towards the Sustainable Data Hub Vision: Karnataka Leading the Way,‚Äù outlines the state‚Äôs roadmap to becoming India‚Äôs sustainable digital hub.
 
Mr. Sunil Gupta, Co- Founder & CEO, Yotta Infrastructure and Chair, ASSOCHAM National Council on Data Centers said,‚ÄúKarnataka is not just enabling the next generation of data centers - it is shaping the digital foundations that will power India‚Äôs AI-driven future. Yotta is proud to invest in this vision with world-class sustainable cloud & AI infrastructure to strengthen the state as a global technology powerhouse.

#bnn #bnnlive  #bangalorenewsnetwork #bengalurunewsnetwork #redmi #xiaomi #iphone #samsung #redminote #pro #oppo #realme #vivo #mi #apple #smartphone #note #huawei #oneplus #s #android #poco #photography #nokia #infinix #a #mobile #g #promax #instagram #hpmurah #technology #mobilephotography #t#pocox #plus #tech #xiomi #asus #redmik #xiaomiindonesia #india #pocof #smartphones #celular #pocom #case #miui #series #phone #jualbelihp #lite #celulares #c #honor #motorola #lg #hp #photooftheday #smartwatch #xiaomiredmi #samsunga #hpsecond #miband

Xiaomi India launches REDMI 15C 5G with sleek design, immersive display and dependable performance
Xiaomi India today announced the launch of the REDMI 15C 5G, a smartphone designed to deliver a sleek aesthetic, a spacious 17.53 cm immersive display, and dependable all-day performance for users who seamlessly switch between work and entertainment.
Commenting on the launch, Anuj Sharma, Chief Marketing Officer, Xiaomi India said, ‚ÄúWith REDMI 15C 5G, our goal was to build a phone that feels effortless in the hands of everyday users. The combination of a big immersive display, a reliable all-day battery and a refined royale design reflects how people now watch, learn and work on their phones. As we look ahead, our focus is on keeping the REDMI experience reliable and built around what truly matters¬†to¬†our¬†users.‚Äù
The REDMI 15C 5G features a slim, polished body with a 3D quad-curved back for a balanced grip and a distinctive floating crater camera design. It comes in Moonlight Blue, Dusk Purple and Midnight Black, with Moonlight Blue crafted through a dual-colour magnetic ink process.
The 17.53 cm HD+ display with up to 120Hz AdaptiveSync delivers smooth, responsive viewing, while the 50MP AI dual camera ensures clear, vibrant photography across bright, indoor and low-light conditions.
A large 6000mAh battery powers the device through extended use, supporting 23 hours of video playback and 106.9 hours of music. With 33W turbo charging, the phone reaches 50% in just 28 minutes, and 10W reverse charging offers added on-the-go convenience. It also comes with a 33W charger in the box.
Powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 6300 octa core processor, the REDMI 15C 5G delivers smooth multitasking, with up to 16GB RAM (with memory extension) and 1TB expandable storage. It runs on Xiaomi HyperOS 2, offering smart features such as Circle to Search with Google, built-in Google Gemini, and Xiaomi interconnectivity tools including Call Sync and Shared Clipboard.
Engineered for everyday durability, the device includes IP64 dust and water resistance and a 200% volume boost for clearer audio in noisy environments.
The REDMI 15C 5G will be available in 4GB+128GB, 6GB+128GB and 8GB+128GB variants. The pricing has been set competitively, with the 4GB+128GB variant priced at ‚Çπ12,499, the 6GB+128GB variant at ‚Çπ13,999, and the 8GB+128GB variant at ‚Çπ15,499.

#bnn #bnnlive  #bangalorenewsnetwork #bengalurunewsnetwork #ramaiah #ramaiahuniversity #bangalore #admissionopen #india #mastersdegree #mysore #seacollege #koshysgroupofinstituions #chennai #spurthy #bachelorsdegree #msedu #ms #acharyainstitutes #brindavancollegeofengineering #sambramcollege #eastpointcollege #jainuniversity #sjcbengaluru #bachelors #indianeducation #firstyear #christcollege #kristujayanticollege #revauniversity #college #ramaiahinstituteoftechnology #btech #ramaiahevolute#engineering #startupfundraising #msramaiahinstituteoftechnology #instagood #msrit #economicoutlook #agriculture #collage #banglore #mba #ieeebangaloresection #technology #ieee #devanhalli #snapseed #service #sustainabilitymatters #gopals #desicows #indiancows #happiness #outdooractivity #volunteer #incollege #loveforcows #team #fieldwork #s #hotelmanagement #indianbreeds#symposium #workshop #research #conference #art #event #health #college #technology #innovation #joinus #wearethewomb #internationalwomensday #femaleempowerment #seminar #qiaf #science #webinar #artist #education #engineering #rabthehappyisland #collegefest #nonbinaryempowerment #rome #party #exhibition #medicine #diversity #instagood#symposium #workshop #research #conference #art #event #health #college #technology #innovation #joinus #wearethewomb #internationalwomensday #femaleempowerment #seminar #qiaf #science #webinar #artist #education #engineering #rabthehappyisland #collegefest #nonbinaryempowerment #rome #party #exhibition #medicine #diversity #instagood#healthcare #food #collegeevents #eur #kunst #sketch #instagram #trending #events #dinner #creativity #tech #equality #networking #presentation #restaurant #perdoski #creativeentrepreneurship #students #viral #genderequality #nature #bitsathy #chennai #empowerment #photography #perdoskisemarang #perdoskibandung #perdoskimalang #perdoskisolo
Ramaiah Memorial Hospital & Ramaiah Medical College to Host Global WBMT Symposium on Cell Therapy in Bengaluru
 Ramaiah Memorial Hospital & Ramaiah Medical College is the epicenter of medical innovation today with the inauguration of the Worldwide Network for Blood and Marrow Transplantation (WBMT) Symposium on Cell Therapy ‚Äì Bengaluru 2025 (a global NGO in official relations with the World Health Organization (WHO), a landmark global scientific convention focused on the future of cellular therapy. (BMT & CART)
The event, co-organized by the Ramaiah Bone Marrow Transplant and Cell Therapy Program‚Äîestablished in 2014 was inaugurated by Mr. K.B. Sivakumar, IAS, Commissioner of Health and Family Welfare Services, Government of Karnataka; Dr. Nagendra Swamy S.C., Chief Executive ‚Äì Ramaiah Memorial Hospital & Healthcare Services - Gokula Educational Foundation (Medical) and Dr. Damiano Rondelli (Chicago, USA), President of the WBMT. The symposium convenes eminent clinicians, scientists, researchers, and global experts from the USA, Europe, UK, Japan, Brazil, Australia, and India to advance dialogue, innovation, and collaboration in CAR-T therapies, hematopoietic cell transplantation, and cutting-edge cellular therapies. The symposium marks a significant milestone for Indian healthcare, focusing on the next frontier of treatment: bone marrow transplants and advanced cell therapies such as CAR-T cells and gene therapy for blood cancers and congenital blood disorders.
WBMT President, Professor Damiano Rondelli commented ‚Äì ‚ÄúThis symposium is extremely important to the mission of WBMT to promote international collaboration, education, and increase capacity building in transplantation and cell therapy worldwide. Gathering speakers from this region of the world will impact access and quality of care for many patients in Asia‚Äù.
Delivering the inaugural address, Dr. Nagendra Swamy S.C., Chief Executive ‚Äì Ramaiah Memorial Hospital & Healthcare Services, Gokula Education Foundation (Medical), highlighted the institution‚Äôs commitment to elevating access to advanced cell therapy and strengthening India‚Äôs position in global healthcare innovation. He said, ‚ÄúThe symposium has come at a very crucial juncture when the science of cell therapy is moving faster so that systems, policies, and training frameworks can catch up to implement global standards. Our priority will be to bridge that gap by creating platforms where science, technology, professional care, and patient needs can align. Bengaluru has talent, an ecosystem, and the collaborative spirit to make a meaningful contribution to global advancements in cell therapy.‚Äù
Representing the global fraternity, the symposium features distinguished WBMT leaders including Damiano Rondelli, President ‚Äì WBMT; Mickey Koh, Vice President ‚Äì WBMT; and Mahmoud Aljurf, Past President ‚Äì WBMT, among other international faculty and senior scientific experts.

title: Apollo Cancer Centre launches its dedicated Apollo Cellular Therapy Blood & Marrow Transplant Center
description:
Please do contact for any news coverage, live streaming and event management.  Contact : 9844873010, 8951966756
E-Mail : info@bangalorenewsnetwork.com
#bnn #bnnlive  #bangalorenewsnetwork #bengalurunewsnetwork

Apollo Cancer Centre (ACC), Bannerghatta Road, Bengaluru, announced the launch of its dedicated Apollo Cellular Therapy and Blood and Marrow Transplant Center, marking a significant milestone in advancing comprehensive cancer and haematology care in Karnataka. The new facility reinforces Apollo‚Äôs commitment to bringing multiple advanced cellular therapies and transplant modalities under one roof, enabling patients to access world-class, evidence-based treatments closer to home.

The launch event was attended by Dr. Neema Bhat, Senior Consultant Hematology BMT Physician and Paediatric Oncology; Prof. Dr. Vijay Agarwal, Senior and Lead consultant - Medical Oncology, Prof Dr Vishwanath S - Senior Consultant and Academic Advisor - Medical Oncology and Haemato oncology; Dr. Poonam Maurya, Senior consultant Medical Oncology and Hemato Oncology; Dr. Aditya Murali, Senior Consultant ‚Äì Medical Oncology and Hemato Oncology. Mr. Akshay Oleti, CEO ‚Äì Karnataka Region, Apollo Hospitals, was also present.

Speaking about the new facility, Dr. Neema Bhat, Senior Consultant Hematology BMT Physician and Paediatric Oncology, Apollo Cancer Centre, Bengaluru, said, ‚ÄúThis launch marks another significant step in Apollo Hospital‚Äôs ongoing mission to make high-end cancer care more accessible in Karnataka. The new centre will cater to a wide range of patients requiring transplants for various conditions, including leukaemia, lymphoma, multiple myeloma, aplastic anaemia, thalassemia, and other complex hematologic disorders. It will be supported by an experienced team of haematologists, oncologists, infectious disease specialists, and critical care experts, working together to provide seamless care from diagnosis to post-transplant recovery. By providing advanced treatment options, the centre aims to improve survival outcomes and quality of life for the patients.‚Äù

Prof Dr Vishwanath S - Senior Consultant and Academic Advisor - Medical Oncology and Haemato oncology, Bengaluru, added, ‚ÄúA dedicated cellular therapy and transplant program must function on clinical discipline. What sets this centre apart is its focus on protocol fidelity, academic oversight, and rigorous infection-control systems. These elements are fundamental to delivering transplants safely and consistently within a well-structured clinical environment.‚Äù

Prof. Dr. Vijay Agarwal, Senior and Lead consultant - Medical Oncology, Bengaluru, said ‚ÄúThe future of cancer treatment lies in harnessing the body‚Äôs own cells to fight disease. With the establishment of this centre, we are creating an ecosystem that combines advanced research, clinical expertise, and compassionate care. Our focus is not only on performing transplants but also on developing next-generation cellular therapies that can transform outcomes in both malignant and non-malignant conditions.‚Äù

Mr. Akshay Oleti, CEO ‚Äì Karnataka Region, Apollo Hospitals, said, ‚ÄúThe launch of this state-of-the-art Centre is a testament to our focus on enhancing Karnataka‚Äôs healthcare infrastructure. With this new facility, we aim to expand access to complex haematology and transplant services for the patients in the State. Our endeavour is to ensure that every patient receives world-class care within their own state, supported by Apollo‚Äôs legacy of trust and excellence.‚Äù

Sharing her perspective, Dr. Poonam Maurya, Senior consultant Medical Oncology and Hemato Oncology, Apollo Cancer Centre, Bengaluru , said, ‚ÄúOne of the most overlooked challenges in transplant medicine is the sheer logistical strain on families‚Äîfrequent consultations, complex investigations, and prolonged admissions. By integrating diagnostics, transplant services, and structured post-transplant follow-up within a single ecosystem, this centre will substantially reduce that load and ensure a more streamlined and supportive care experience.‚Äù

Commenting on the significance of the new center, Dr. Aditya Murali, Senior Consultant ‚Äì Medical Oncology and Haemato oncology, Apollo Cancer Centre, Bengaluru , said, ‚ÄúCellular therapies are evolving at a remarkable pace, spanning allogeneic and haploidentical transplants to increasingly sophisticated immune-engineered interventions. Delivering these modalities requires controlled environments, multidisciplinary coordination, and strict adherence to validated clinical protocols. This facility strengthens our ability to administer such therapies with the precision they demand.‚Äù


#WinningOverCancer

title: AIAMA EXPO 2025 - A new era for India‚Äôs agarbathi industry with BIS certification launch
description:
Please do contact for any news coverage, live streaming and event management.  Contact : 9844873010, 8951966756
E-Mail : info@bangalorenewsnetwork.com
#bnn #bnnlive  #bangalorenewsnetwork #bengalurunewsnetwork

The All India Agarbathi Manufacturers Association (AIAMA) inaugurated AIAMA EXPO 2025,  India‚Äôs largest international conference and exhibition for the agarbathi industry at Tripura Vasini, Palace Grounds, Bengaluru.

The three-day event, themed ‚ÄòTraditionally Modern,‚Äô was inaugurated by Smt. Shobha Karandlaje, Union Minister of State for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises. She also unveiled the Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) Certification,  to establish a new quality benchmark to elevate India‚Äôs incense manufacturing to global standards.

Speaking at the inauguration, Smt. Shobha Karandlaje, Union Minister of State for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, said, ‚ÄúThe Indian agarbathi industry is the essence of our culture, craftsmanship and sacred prayer. With the introduction of BIS certification, we are ensuring that Indian incense products meet the highest global quality standards. We aim to create awareness about the agarbathi industry, which has been falsely portrayed as harmful, while also calling for research-backed scientific evidence.‚Äù

The Expo brings together industry experts, innovators, and thought leaders for curated sessions on fragrance, sustainability, and entrepreneurship. The inaugural day featured renowned mythologist Devdutt Pattanaik, who shared insights on the symbolism of fragrance in Indian tradition and spirituality. The upcoming sessions will include business coach Rajiv Talreja leading a discussion on scaling family-run enterprises and the ‚ÄòNose Royale‚Äô Perfume Creation Competition, celebrating craftsmanship and innovation in perfumery.

Mr. Ambica Ramanjaneyulu, President, AIAMA, and Managing Director, Ambica Group of Companies, said, ‚ÄúAIAMA EXPO 2025 marks a defining moment in our industry‚Äôs journey. It brings together manufacturers, suppliers, and innovators under one roof to celebrate 75 years of legacy while embracing a future driven by quality, sustainability, and growth.‚Äù

Mr. Arjun Ranga, Chairman, AIAMA EXPO Committee 2025, and Managing Director, Cycle Pure Agarbathi, added, ‚ÄúThe Expo showcased how the agarbathi industry is evolving by combining traditional artistry with modern business practices. This collaboration will not only empower manufacturers but also reinforce India‚Äôs position as the global hub for fragrance creation.‚Äù

Spread across 120,000 square feet, the Expo will have curated seminars that will cover various aspects of the agarbathi Industry including job creation, sourcing of raw materials, research on new fragrances, packaging developments, women empowerment, export opportunities and new-age marketing.

title: Ideal Neighbourhood ‚Ä¢ Ideal Society | Jummah Khutbah by Maulana Waheeduddin Umri Madani
description:
#JummahKhutbah #FridaySermon #MaulanaWaheeduddinUmriMadani #IdealSociety #IdealNeighbourhood #IslamicReminder #IslamicLecture #JummahMubarak #Khutbah #Masjid #SaadBinAbiWaqqasMasjid #MuslimCommunity #IslamicEducation #Spirituality #quranandsunnah 


In this inspiring Jummah Khutbah, Maulana Waheeduddin Umri Madani delivers a powerful message on building an Ideal Neighbourhood and an Ideal Society ‚Äî grounded in the values of the Qur‚Äôan and the teachings of Prophet Muhammad Ô∑∫.

The khutbah emphasises:

The responsibility of every Muslim towards their community

How good character transforms society

The importance of unity, compassion, justice, and peaceful living

The role of Masjid as the heart of the neighbourhood

How the example of the Sahaba built a strong and harmonious society

This Friday sermon was delivered at Saad bin Abi Waqqas Masjid.

‚ú® May Allah guide us to live with empathy and integrity and help us become better neighbours and stronger believers. Ameen.

Watch, learn and share to spread the message.

Adalaton Per Qabza?| Muslim Leaders Maidan Me |Milli Council
description:
Adalaton par badhte hue fascism ke qabze ke khilaf, Bangalore me All india Milli Council ne foundation day ke mouqe per ek aham 3-roza ijlas mun‚Äòaqid kiya jisme mulk aur riyasat ke mashhoor ulama, Muslim leaders, social activists aur kanooni mahireen ne shirkat ki.Is ijlas ka maqsad yeh tha ke kis tarah Muslim community aur doosri pichhadi qaumein naye kanooni dabao aur judicial discrimination ka s√¢mna karein ‚Äî aur unke liye ek mushtarka plan tay ho. devraj urs bhavan ke ijlas me  speakers ne bataya ke ‚ÄúAdalaton ki azadi mulk ki rooh hai. Agar fascist soch ne judiciary ko apni zabt mein liya to aam aadmi ki awaz kahin dab jayegi.‚ÄùMuslim leaders ne zordar taur par kaha ke waqt aagaya hai ke community taleem, kanoon, media aur public activism mein apni representation ko mazboot kare.Ijlas ke teesre din, ek joint resolution pass kiya gaya jisme demand rakhi gayi ke judiciary reforms transparent hon, bail aur trial processes speed up kiye jayein, aur cases mein religious profiling ka silsila rokha jaye.Aaj ka yeh maidan, Bangalore ki Muslim community ka ek bebaak paighaam hai ‚Äî ‚ÄúHum adl-o-insaf ke liye khare hain, aur fascist dabao ke aage jhukne wale nahi.‚Äù expert analysis aur ground reality ke liye press conference ki yeh report dekhen

title: Madrason Me Kya Hota Hai | Ladkiyon Ki Taleem Kyun Zaroori
description:
Madrason me kya hota hai?
Aaj is ka ek khoobsurat namoona Jamia Umme Kulsum Lil Banat ki bacchiyon ne sabit kar diya. Deeni mahaul me parhne wali in nanhi talibaat ne sirf Deeni Taleem hi nahi, balki School Education me bhi top numbers hasil karke saabit kiya ke agar irade mazboot hon to madrasay sirf ibadat aur taleem ka markaz hi nahi, balki academic excellence ka bhi behtareen zariya ban sakte hain.Jamia ki bacchiyon ne school exams me shandaar kamyabi hasil ki, jis par unko awards aur inamaat se nawaza gaya. Unki mehnat, unke teachers ki rehnumai aur positive taleemi mahaul. yeh sab mil kar ek aisa message deta hai ke Deeni aur Dunyavi taleem aik dosray ki mukhalif nahi, balke mukammal karne wali hain.Is video me aap in lambi mehnaton ka safar, in bacchiyon ka jazba, teachers ki dedication aur parents ka bharpoor saath dekhein ge.Ayein, un nanhi sitaron ki hosla-afzai karein aur duniya ko bataein ke ‚ÄúMadrasay Roshan Muashray ki Bunyad hain.‚Äù

title: Bangalore Me Tahaffuz e Risalat Ke Jalse Ko Rukwane Ki Sazish?
description:
Bismillah Nagar, Bangalore me Tahaffuz-e-Khatme nubuwwat ka jalsa mun'aqid hone ja raha tha, magar afsos ke kuch ulama ne khud hi is program ko rukwane ki koshish ki. Ilzaamat, dabao aur backdoor me chalne wali siyasat ne shehr ke logon ko pareshaan kar diya. Logon ka kehna hai ke ye tamam sazish sirf apna robe jamaane, apni qabiliyat ko dikhane, aur awaam ko confuse karne ki koshish lagti hai.Is puray masle ne community me naya sawal paida kar diya hai ke kya hamare religious events bhi ab personal ego aur power show ki bhent chadh rahe hain?Jalse ke organizer Moulana muzammil mazahiri ka kehna hai ke unka maqsad sirf Tahaffuz-e-Risalat, millat ki hidayat, aur amn ka paigham phailana tha. Lekin kuch logon ne isko bhi apni siyasat ka hissa bana diya. log is waqt confusion ka shikar hain, aur social media par is issue par garam behas jaari hai.press conference ki is report me hum aapko tamam ground updates, reactions aur asli surat-e-haal se aagaah karenge. Aap apni rai comment section me zaroor share karein.

title: Vote Chori Issue | Sarvagna Nagar Me Sarkar Per Bada Hamla
description:
Vote Chori ka issue ab Sarvagna Nagar me sarkar ke liye nayi museebat ban gaya hai. Loktantra ke buniyadi usool par sawaal uthate hue MLA KJ George ne local level par voters list me chhedchhad aur fake entries ke ilzaam samne laaye.unka kehna hai ke election process ko manipulate karke awaaz ko dabaane ki koshish ho rahi hai. Social workers aur local leaders ka kehna hai ke ye sirf ek constituency ka masla nahi, balki poore democratic system par dhabba hai.
Is video me hum aapko dikhayenge ke kis tarah se vote chori ke ilzaam badhte ja rahe hain, kis ne kya bayan diya aur kis had tak ye issue ab political storm ban gaya hai. Ye awaaz hai un logon ki jo apna haq chahte hain ‚Äî ek imaandaar aur transparent election process.

title: Caste Survey Per organisations Active | Ahmed Raza Movement Ki Pehel
description:
Caste Survey ke issue par Karnataka ki siyasat ek nayi disha le rahi hai. Mukhtalif organisations ab iss mamle par active ho gayi hain aur awaam ke beech jagrukta paida karne ki koshish kar rahi hain. Ahmed Raza Movement ne bhi is silsile me pehel uthai hai aur yeh wazeh kiya hai ke caste survey sirf ek hisaab kitaab nahi, balke insaaf, haqooq aur barabri ka mamla hai.Ahmed Raza Movement ka kehna hai ke gareeb tabqe, pichdi jaatiyon aur minorities ki asal haalat samajhne ke liye caste survey lazmi hai. Sirf isi se maloom hoga ke asal masail kya hain aur kahan par resources ki sabse zyada zarurat hai. Yeh survey sarkar ko zimmedar banayega ke wo awaam ke haq me policies banaye.Is video me hum batayenge ke organisations kaise active ho rahi hain, Ahmed Raza Movement ne kya strategy banayi hai aur kis tarah se awaam ko involve karke is masle ko ek bade tehreek ki shakal dene ki koshish ki ja rahi hai.

title: I Love Muhammed Kehna Jurm Hai? | Giraftari Kyun | 1 Lakh Stickers Banenge
description:
Kya "Love Muhammed" kehna jurm hai? Yehi sawal aaj samajh aur siyasat dono ke samne khara hai. Ek jawan ko sirf is liye giraftar kiya gaya ke usne "Love Muhammed" ka paigham uthaya. Is arrest ne na sirf awaam ko hairan kar diya balki insaaf aur azadi-e-bayan par bhi bade sawalat khade kar diye hain.musalmano ka aqeeda hai ke Muhammed Ô∑∫ se muhabbat ka izhar hamara iman hai, jurm nahi. Ab is paigham ko aur zyada aage badhane ke liye ek naye tehreek ka aaghaz hua hai jisme 1 lakh stickers banaye ja rahe hain, jo shehr shehr aur gali gali me lagaye jayenge. Ye stickers ek symbol honge ke haq ki awaaz ko dabaaya nahi ja sakta.Is video me hum aapko dikhayenge ke kis tarah arrest hone ke bawajood logon ka jazba aur mohabbat aur mazboot hui hai. Yeh masjid na sirf namaz aur roohani sukoon ka markaz hai balki muqtalif social activities me bhi barh chadh kar hissa le rahi hai. title: KG Halli | KJ George Ka Skill Development Programme | Kelachandra Foundation
description:
KG Halli Bangalore me ek aham program ka in‚Äòiqad hua jahan MLA KJ George ki company Kelachandra Foundation ki janib se chalaye ja rahe Skill Development Centre ke students ko certificates taqseem kiye gaye. Is mauqe par foundation ke representatives ne kaha ke unka maqsad aurton ko sirf taleem tak mehdood rakhna nahi, balke unhe rozgar ke laayak skills dena hai taake woh apne parivaron ka sahara ban saken.Students ne apni training complete karne ke baad jo confidence aur jazba dikhaya, usne ye sabit kar diya ke agar sahi platform mile to aaurten kisi bhi maidan me apna mustaqbil roshan bana sakte hain. Program ke dauran mukhtalif skills jaise computer education, tailoring, technical courses aur personality development ke students ne apni stories share ki jo kafi preranadayak sabit hui.Kelachandra Foundation ke representatives ne wada kiya ke aane wale waqt me aur bhi zyada skill development programs aur training modules introduce kiye jayenge taake aur zyada students mustafeed ho saken. KG Halli aur aas paas ke ilaqon ke liye ye ek bari khushi ki baat hai ke aise initiatives lekar aaya ja rahe hain jahan aurten apni zindagi behtareen banane ki taraf qadam barha saken.

title: Marathahalli‚Äôs Dangerous Footpaths & How Pedestrians üö∂ suffer? #bengaluru #bmtc #publictransport
description:
Marathahalli is one of Bengaluru‚Äôs busiest transit points ‚Äî yet the footpath leading to the bus stop is unsafe and severely neglected.

Broken slabs, unstable pavements, exposed utilities, and narrow walking spaces put thousands of commuters at risk every single day.

For students, women, seniors, and office-goers who depend on BMTC along the ORR, reaching the bus stop itself becomes a challenge.

This raises key questions:
‚Ä¢ How did such an important footpath remain in this condition for so long?
‚Ä¢ Why hasn‚Äôt Bengaluru East City Corporation under GBA acted yet?
‚Ä¢ How can Bengaluru promote public transport without safe pedestrian access?

Footpaths are a basic necessity for a safe city ‚Äî not an optional add-on.

title: Risk Demolition if you don‚Äôt follow building plan #bengaluru #construction #gba #bengalurupost
description:
Thinking of building your dream home in Bengaluru?
Here‚Äôs something you must get right from Day 1.

The Greater Bengaluru Authority now insists that every home must follow the approved plan ‚Äî no deviations, no ‚Äúsmall changes,‚Äù no adjustments on-site. And this isn‚Äôt just a rule on paper anymore.

Bengaluru East has already started acting against buildings that went ahead despite notices. Structures that didn‚Äôt correct deviations are now facing demolition, and owners are losing peace, time, and money.

To avoid the same headache:
‚Ä¢ Get your plinth-line marking done before you start work.
‚Ä¢ Collect your foundation certificate.
‚Ä¢ Keep your approved plan at the site at all times.
‚Ä¢ Build exactly as sanctioned ‚Äî it protects you.
‚Ä¢ Expect regular inspections from ward engineers.

These guidelines are meant to help homeowners avoid future legal trouble and ensure your investment stays safe.

üè° If someone you know is planning to build ‚Äî or is already building ‚Äî tag them.

One small violation can turn into a big problem in Bengaluru today.

description:
Work on the long-delayed Ejipura flyover has finally picked up steam, with engineers reporting strong progress on segment installation, ramp works and footpath finishing. After years of slow movement, the project is now moving at its fastest pace yet.

The only major hurdle? A 700m land stretch near St. John‚Äôs that still needs clearance. Once that‚Äôs resolved, the flyover connecting Koramangala, Ejipura and the IRR corridor can head toward a mid-2026 finish.

title: Kalasipalya Bus stand üöè exposed #bengaluru more details in caption #bengalurupost
description:
Kalasipalya Bus Stand ‚Äî one of Bengaluru‚Äôs oldest and busiest transit hubs ‚Äî is in a shocking state of neglect.
Despite serving over 3 lakh passengers every single day, the infrastructure remains unsafe, unhygienic, and poorly maintained.

In this ground report, BengaluruPost captures the real condition of the Kalasipalya bus stand:
‚Ä¢ Broken and missing footpaths
‚Ä¢ Garbage piled up for days
‚Ä¢ Open urination near bus bays
‚Ä¢ Slippery, unsafe walking surfaces
‚Ä¢ No proper signboards for toilets
‚Ä¢ Overflowing drains and foul smell
‚Ä¢ Zero coordination between BMTC, KSRTC, BBMP & GBA
‚Ä¢ Commuters ‚Äî especially women, elderly and children ‚Äî struggling for basic dignity

Located near KR Market and Victoria Hospital, this bus stand should represent Bengaluru‚Äôs efficiency ‚Äî instead, it exposes severe gaps in civic maintenance and passenger safety.

What needs to change?

‚úî Clean, functional toilets with proper signage
‚úî Regular cleaning and patrolling
‚úî Announcements & signage against littering
‚úî Fines for dumping garbage
‚úî Continuous, safe footpaths
‚úî Immediate repair of potholes
‚úî Clear ownership between BMTC, KSRTC, BBMP and GBA

Why this video matters:

This is not a minor inconvenience ‚Äî it is a public health, safety, and dignity issue for lakhs of people who depend on this bus stand daily.

Have you seen this situation yourself?

Let‚Äôs demand a clean, safe, commuter-friendly Kalasipalya that Bengaluru truly deserves.

title: Caught this at an IOCL petrol pump in Bengaluru üëÄ‚õΩÔ∏è #bengaluru #indianoil. Read caption
description:
Consumers who fill petrol or diesel should be cautious and check the meter reading carefully.‚õΩÔ∏è

At the IndianOil petrol pump ‚Äî Lakshmamma & Sons, Devegowda Road, RT Nagar, Bengaluru ‚Äî our cameraman and several customers noticed irregularities while refueling. 

During the filling process, the meter showed variations of 4, 5, 6, 10, or even 15 ml or more, differing with the amount filled by each consumer.

Several consumers questioned the staff, leading to arguments. The manager claimed it was due to gun ‚Äúcalibration‚Äù issues. 

A complaint has been raised with IOCL Bengaluru, and a firm reply is awaited. But how can calibration keep changing for every fill?

Is this normal or something amiss? Many consumers have noticed this ‚Äî have you too? 

#bengaluru #bengalurupost #fuelfraud #indianoil #bangalurunews

title: Bengaluru‚Äôs Business Corridor- PRR road update - Oct 2025 #bengaluru #prr #bbc
description:
Bengaluru‚Äôs long-awaited Business Corridor is finally gaining momentum!

The Peripheral Ring Road, now renamed as the Bengaluru Business Corridor (BBC), is set to be a game-changer ‚Äî an 8-lane, 74 km expressway with space for a future Metro line, cycling tracks, and pedestrian paths.

BDA is currently in talks with farmers for land acquisition, a key hurdle that officials say could soon see a breakthrough. With HUDCO agreeing to finance the project, the plan is finally shifting from paper to progress.

Once completed, the BBC will be a tolled corridor, unlocking vast real estate and business opportunities around Tumakuru Road, Ballari Road, KR Puram, Sarjapura, and Hosur Road.

Though it may take 7‚Äì8 years at BDA‚Äôs pace, this corridor could redefine how Bengaluru moves ‚Äî and grows.

üí¨ Bengaluru desperately needs the BBC to move ‚Äî not just vehicles, but the city itself forward.

#bengaluru #bengalurubusinesscorridor #peripheralringroad #bda #bbmp #bengaluruupdate #urbanmobility #hudco #bengalurudevelopment #infrastructure #realestate #nammaooru #northbangalore #bengalururoads #gba #greaterbengaluru #prrroad #realestate #infrastructure #bengalurupost

title: Alternate route to Bengaluru Airport? A reality check? Hennur-Bagaluru Road #bengaluru
description:
üö® Is this the alternate route to Bengaluru Airport? A reality check üö¶

Residents, RWAs, and commuters regularly face the treacherous conditions on the entire stretch from Sparsh Hospital ‚Äì Bagalur Colony up to the airport. Potholes and broken sections at Railway Underpass, Kothnur, Bagalur Colony Main Road, Koshy‚Äôs Group of Institutions, Capital Market, Reliance Digital Kothnur make this alternate airport route painfully dangerous for all vehicles. üõµüöóüöç

In this video, we‚Äôve covered the whole stretch across these key points, showing how widespread and unsafe the situation really is. One of our followers, Rajeev Ranjan, who travels this road daily, also shared his ordeal that reflects what many residents face.

While BBMP may have plans for an elevated road here, this cannot excuse the current state of the road. Over the years, civic authorities have neglected this route, leaving commuters frustrated and at risk.

üëâ If this stretch is improved, it would ease stress on Hebbal Junction, and people from East Bengaluru could use this road instead of entering the tolled expressway via Hebbal.

Commuters can‚Äôt wait for long-term projects ‚Äî they need safe, usable roads today.

title: üö® Daylight extortion attempt in Bengaluru‚Äôs KR Puram ‚Äî caught on dashcam! #bengaluru #extortion
description:
üìç Caught on Cam: Daylight Attempted Extortion in Bengaluru

A shocking road incident unfolded on KR Puram Road on 24 July 2025, when two unidentified men pretended to be hit by a moving car, then banged on the vehicle‚Äôs windows ‚Äî seemingly trying to extort or intimidate the driver.

üé• Fortunately, the driver had a dashcam rolling, capturing everything.
The moment the men realised they were being recorded and heard the driver alert others ‚Äî they vanished.

This video was shared with @bengalurupost by our follower and has also been submitted to Bengaluru Traffic Police. We're hopeful the culprits will be identified and caught soon.

But this incident raises chilling questions:
üîπ What if there was no dashcam?
üîπ How does something like this happen in broad daylight?
üîπ Are similar patterns emerging in other cities too?

This is not an isolated case, and it‚Äôs time for authorities to investigate and step up road safety efforts.

üöò Stay alert, Bengaluru. Here‚Äôs what you can do:
‚úÖ Install a dashcam ‚Äî it can be your best witness
‚úÖ Keep doors locked and windows rolled up, especially in traffic
‚úÖ Stay calm, assess the situation, and seek help from bystanders if possible
‚úÖ Report any such acts immediately by dialing 112

Let‚Äôs stay vigilant and look out for one another on the roads.
üõë Shared by @bengalurupost1  to inform, alert, and protect.

Feeding pigeons üê¶ then you should know this #bengaluru
description:
üö´ Mumbai has banned pigeon feeding.
But in Bengaluru, public spots like temples, markets, and rooftops still turn into unofficial kabootar khanas üê¶

Doctors, experts, and recent news reports warn:
Pigeon droppings can cause serious lung diseases, brain infections, and bacterial illnesses ‚Äî especially in crowded cities.

‚ö†Ô∏è Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs linked to it:
ü´Å Asthma-like lung damage (Hypersensitivity Pneumonitis)
üß† Fungal brain infections (Cryptococcal Meningitis)
ü¶† Pneumonia-like illness (Psittacosis)

üè• Long-term exposure is now seen as a major urban health risk.

Should Bengaluru act before it becomes a bigger problem?

üë• Tag someone who feeds pigeons
üí¨ Comment what you think ‚¨áÔ∏è

Republic Kannada (‡≤∞‡≤ø‡≤™‡≤¨‡≥ç‡≤≤‡≤ø‡≤ï‡≥ç ‡≤ï‡≤®‡≥ç‡≤®‡≤°) is a 24x7 Kannada news channel in India and the 4th broadcast news operation of Republic Media Network. Set to disrupt the Kannada news genre with the Republic Media Network‚Äôs iconic news values. It will bring accountability-driven journalism. It will be investigation-focused in its approach to the news & will be citizen-oriented in terms of on-air content. Republic Kannada will reflect the impact-chasing DNA.

Welcome to Karnataka TV

Karnataka TV is Karnataka's No.1 digital media channel and website, delivering news in Kannada from Karnataka, across India and around the world on a digital platform. We are broadcasting you reliable news, regional headlines and global perspectives daily. K.M. Shivakumar (Shivu Besagarahalli) is the founder of Karnataka TV and has 15 years of experience in the media field. He has worked in Suvarna News, Public TV, Kasturi News, News 18 Kannada, TV5 Kannada channels. He has also built a young and enthusiastic team including Krishnappa, Basavaraj Kahale and is running the district-wise Karnataka TV digital channels.

title: Burger Singh sets new QSR record with 3300+ free meals served in Bengaluru!
description:
Burger Singh Sets a New QSR Record: 3300 Plus Free Meals Served in a Single Day as Bengaluru Turns Up in Massive Numbers
A record 15000 Plus Registrations. Citywide Queues. Bengaluru Delivers Unprecedented Love for India‚Äôs Largest Homegrown Burger Brand.
Bangalore, 24 November 2025: Burger Singh has created a new milestone in India‚Äôs QSR industry through its citywide campaign The Big Singh Feast, organised to celebrate the brand‚Äôs launch in Bengaluru and its rapid expansion across the city. As part of this celebration, Burger Singh served more than 3300 free meals in a single day across its Sarjapur, HSR Layout and BTM Layout outlets. The activation drew a record-breaking 15000 plus registrations, with the scale of interest and footfall so extraordinary that many on-ground observers speculated it could be India‚Äôs biggest ever turnout for a QSR-led community event of this kind. In fact, the queues matched and even surpassed what India typically sees during blockbuster movie premieres and flagship smartphone launches.
From 12 pm to 10 pm, all three locations witnessed continuous, high-intensity footfall, with long queues forming even before opening hours and customers waiting patiently to grab their free meals. Families, students, working professionals and neighbourhood residents turned the day into a full-fledged citywide celebration.
As part of The Big Singh Feast giveaway, customers received two of Burger Singh‚Äôs most loved offerings: the Big Crispy Chicken Meal and the Udta Punjab 2.0 Meal, paired with Dilli 6 Fries and the signature Gulabo drink. Guests praised the bold desi flavours, the juiciness of the burgers, the uniquely seasoned fries and the refreshing masala-infused Gulabo. Many first-timers noted how distinctly different and more flavour-rich Burger Singh‚Äôs offerings were compared to typical international burger brands.
A major driver behind this unprecedented response was the Big Singh Feast campaign, a sharply executed digital-plus-offline initiative that built massive awareness and excitement across the city. The digital push included targeted hyperlocal communication, countdown content, WhatsApp amplification and a series of hilarious, AI-generated reels that went viral and significantly boosted shareability and registrations. Offline efforts included neighbourhood visibility, in-store communication, standees and strong on-ground mobilisation across Sarjapur, HSR and BTM. Together, these elements created a powerful funnel that delivered exceptional reach, recall and registration numbers.

title: AssisTech Foundation Board Members and industry leaders congratulate the ATF Award Winners
description:
Innovation with Purpose - AssisTech Foundation Honours Trailblazers Transforming Assistive Technology in India at Bengaluru Tech Summit 2025
These awards are an emphatic recognition and acknowledgement of the innovations developed by Startups &  Enablers through Assistive Technology

Bengaluru, November 21st, 2025: AssisTech Foundation (ATF), India‚Äôs pioneering organization accelerating Assistive Technology (AT) innovations that empower Persons with Disabilities (PwDs), announced the winners of the 5th Edition of the ATF Awards at the Bengaluru Tech Summit (BTS) - AT Track 2025.  The 28th edition of BTS is an initiative of the Department of Electronics, Information Technology and Biotechnology, Govt. of Karnataka, in partnership with industry stakeholders, and brings the world of technology and business together.

title: Kerala Literature Festival 2026  400 Global Voices to Gather at Kozhikode Beach  Asia‚Äôs Largest Lit
description:
Kerala Literature Festival 2026 to Unite 400 Global Voices at Kozhikode Beach

The Ninth Edition of Asia‚Äôs Largest and world‚Äôs most attended Literary Festival Was Announced at a Successful Pre-Event Showcase in Bengaluru

Bengaluru, November 17th, 2025: The ninth edition of the Kerala Literature Festival (KLF) will be held from January 22 to 25, 2026 at the Kozhikode beachfront, the city recognised as India‚Äôs first UNESCO City of Literature. Since its inception in 2016, KLF has grown into Asia‚Äôs largest and world‚Äôs most attended literary conclave, attracting more than 650,000 visitors and over 600 speakers in its previous edition and becoming one of India‚Äôs most anticipated cultural gathering where literature, ideas, art, music, cinema, and performance come together in an open and inclusive space. 

Ahead of the upcoming festival, a dedicated campaign titled ‚ÄòAn Event Beyond Words‚Äô was introduced as part of efforts toward promoting the next edition among marketing professionals, advertising professionals, business influencers, and brand owners. As part of this campaign, a pre-event showcase was held in Bengaluru where details related to KLF 2026 were outlined for attendees.

The 2026 edition is set to be even more dynamic, presenting a wider range of voices and experiences that reflect the evolving landscape of global thought and creativity. Over four days, the festival will feature over 400 speakers and 250 sessions spread across seven parallel tracks, with ten sessions per track each day, 15 participating countries, followed by evening performances and musical events on Kozhikode beach. Each day will bring together readers, writers, and artists for discussions that move fluidly between genres and disciplines, turning Kozhikode into a city of ideas.

title: ICL Fincorp's New NCD Issue Opens on 17th NOVEMBER 2025, Offering Effective Yield up to 12.62%
description:
ICL Fincorp's New NCD Issue Opens on 17th NOVEMBER 2025, Offering Effective Yield up to 12.62%
Bengaluru 14th November 2025 ICL Fincorp is proud to announce the launch of its latest public issue of Secured Redeemable Non-Convertible Debentures (NCDs), opening on 17th November 2025. With an effective yield of up to 12.62%, this offering presents an attractive and secure investment opportunity for those seeking flexible tenures.
Following the remarkable response to our previous NCD issues, we are truly honored by the trust and confidence placed in us by our valued investors. This continued support inspires us to deliver even more robust financial solutions tailored to the evolving needs of our customers.

The NCD issue will remain open until 28th November 2025 and is rated CRISIL BBB-
/STABLE. Each NCD carries a face value of ‚Çπ1,000, and the issue offers ten options, with tenures of 13, 24, 36, 60 and 70 months, with monthly, annual and cumulative interest options with interest rates ranging from 10.50% to 12.62%. The minimum application amount is
‚Çπ10,000, making it accessible to a broad spectrum of investors.

Proceeds from this issue will be strategically deployed to support ICL Fincorp‚Äôs growth initiatives and further enhance the quality of services offered to our customers and stakeholders across India. This step reaffirms our commitment to delivering reliable, innovative and customer-centric financial solutions.

title: Techademy Launches HEXp to Drive NEP 2020 and Karnataka Education Policy Goals
description: echademy Launches HEXp to Drive NEP 2020 and Karnataka Education Policy Goals Bengaluru, India | 14th November 2025: Techademy, a pioneer in skilling and digital learning transformation, hosted the Techademy Summit 2025 and officially launched HEXp (Higher Education Experience Platform), an AI-powered higher education platform aligned with India‚Äôs National Education Policy (NEP) 2020 and the Karnataka State Education Policy 2025, contributing to the larger vision of Viksit Bharat 2047. Held at The Ritz-Carlton, Bangalore, the landmark hybrid event brought together over 500 in-person guests and 500 virtual attendees from across India, including academic leaders, corporate L&D heads, HR professionals, industry experts and policymakers. The summit was graced by the Chief Guest of Honour, Shri Dinesh Gundu Rao, Hon‚Äôble Minister of Health and Family Welfare, Government of Karnataka, who inaugurated the event and emphasized the importance of integrating skill-based learning into India‚Äôs education framework to prepare students for the future workforce. Launch of HEXp: Bridging Academia and Industry Presiding over the event, Dr. Keshav Raju, Co-founder and CEO, led the grand reveal and official launch of Techademy HEXp, a transformative platform designed to bridge the gap between academia and industry through experiential learning, adaptive intelligence, and immersive technology.

title: Capillary Technologies India Limited‚Äôs Initial Public Offering to open on Friday November 14, 2025
description:
Capillary Technologies India Limited‚Äôs Initial Public Offering to open on Friday November 14, 2025, price band set at ‚Çπ549‚Äì ‚Çπ577 per Equity Share
¬†
ÔÇ∑Price band of ‚Çπ549 to ‚Çπ577/- per Equity Share bearing face value of ‚Çπ2/- each (‚ÄúEquity Shares‚Äù)
ÔÇ∑Bid/Offer Opening Date - Friday, November 14, 2025 and Bid/Offer Closing Date ‚Äì Tuesday, November 18, 2025.
ÔÇ∑Minimum Bid Lot is 25 Equity Shares and in multiples of 25 Equity Shares thereafter

Bangalore, November 13, 2025:  Capillary Technologies India Limited (‚ÄúCompany‚Äù) has fixed the price band of¬†‚Çπ549/-¬†to¬†‚Çπ577/-¬†per Equity Share of face value ‚Çπ 2/- each for its initial public offer.
The Initial Public Offering (‚ÄúIPO‚Äù or¬†‚ÄúIssue‚Äù) of the Company will open on¬†November 14, 2025, for subscription and close on November 18, 2025. can bid for a minimum of 25 Equity Shares and in multiples of 25 Equity Shares thereafter.
The IPO is a fresh issue of equity shares of face value ‚Çπ 2/- each (‚ÄúEquity Shares‚Äù) aggregating to ‚Çπ 3450.00 million and an offer-for-sale for 92,28,796 Equity Shares.
The Net Proceeds from the fresh issue to the extent of up to ‚Çπ 1,430.00 million will be utilized for funding its cloud infrastructure costs, up to ‚Çπ 715.81 million for investment in research, designing and development of Company‚Äôs products and platform, up to ‚Çπ 103.42 million for investment in purchase of computer systems for its business and the balance for funding inorganic growth through unidentified acquisitions and general corporate purposes (The amount to be utilised for general corporate purposes and towards unidentified acquisitions and other strategic initiatives shall not, in aggregate, exceed 35% of the Gross Proceeds, out of which the amounts to be utilized towards either of (i) general corporate purposes, or (ii) unidentified acquisitions will not exceed 25% of the gross proceeds. Further, the utilization of Net Proceeds towards funding inorganic growth through unidentified acquisitions and general corporate purposes shall be done in such a manner to ensure that the Company does not utilise more than 50% of the proceeds from fresh issue towards funding any capital expenditure (including towards funding the unidentified acquisitions)).
The Company is a software product company offering artificial intelligence (AI)-based cloud-native Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) products and solutions primarily to enterprise customer globally to develop loyalty of its consumer and channel partners. As of September 2025, based on benchmarking with its peer group and the breadth of its offerings, the Company stands out as one of the global leader in loyalty and engagement management. (Source: Zinnov Report)

title: LuLu Forex Expands Presence in Bangalore with the Inauguration of its 32nd Customer Engagement
description:
LuLu Forex Expands Presence in Bangalore with the Inauguration of its 32nd Customer Engagement Centre at Whitefield

Bangalore, India: LuLu Forex, one of India‚Äôs most trusted names in foreign exchange and outward remittance has inaugurated its 32nd Customer Engagement Centre at Nallurahalli, Whitefield, Bangalore.

The new customer engagement centre was inaugurated by Mr. Narayan Pradhan, COO & CHRO, LuLu Financial Holdings, in the presence of Mr. Shibu Mohammed, AVP, LuLu Forex, and Mr. Ajit John, Deputy CEO, LuLu Forex.


‚ÄúLuLu Forex‚Äôs continued expansion across India reflects our focus on accessibility, reliability and digital innovation. Bangalore remains one of our most important markets and the opening of the Whitefield centre strengthens our promise of convenience for customers in key residential and business hubs. Our vision remains clear, as we grow, to empower people with world-class financial services that are simple, secure and customer-centric.‚Äù, quoted Mr. Adeeb Ahamed, Managing Director of LuLu Financial Holdings.


Speaking at the inauguration, Mr. Narayan Pradhan said, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre delighted to expand our presence in Bangalore with the launch of our new Customer Engagement Centre in Whitefield, a dynamic neighbourhood that truly represents the city‚Äôs global outlook. Our commitment to delivering an extended customer experience that goes beyond transactions combining trusted service, innovative technology and human connection. We aim to bring our customers closer to seamless and personalised financial solutions with each new customer engagement centre.‚Äù


The Whitefield centre will offer customers a reliable suite of financial services, including Currency Exchange, Outward Remittances and Travel Cards, along with a range of value-added services designed to meet the diverse needs of international travellers and residents alike.

Renowned for its customer-first approach and innovative digital solutions, LuLu Forex continues to enhance convenience through its Online Forex platform, enabling customers to buy or sell foreign currency, book travel cards and enjoy doorstep delivery all with just a few clicks.

LuLu Forex strengthens its footprint in Bangalore with the launch and now operating two customer engagement centres; the first at Shivaji Nagar and the newly inaugurated one at Whitefield, strategically located in one of the city‚Äôs key IT and residential hubs. This expansion underscores the company‚Äôs commitment to providing greater accessibility and convenience to professionals and residents across the region.

LuLu Forex has built a robust pan Indian presence, with Customer Engagement Centres across major cities and key international airports ensuring travellers have easy access to trusted forex and remittance services.

As the Regional Fintech Partner of the Argentine Football Association (AFA), LuLu Forex continues to uphold the spirit of excellence, reliability and trust reaffirming its commitment to delivering seamless and customer centric financial solutions across India.

title: IndiGo CEO Breaks Silence: Full Normalcy Only Between Dec 10‚Äì15 | Major Update | News9
description:
IndiGo CEO Peter Elbers has finally issued a detailed statement on the massive nationwide flight disruptions, revealing that Dec 5 saw over 1,000 cancellations‚Äîthe worst day yet. Elbers apologised to passengers for the unprecedented chaos and said operations will take time to stabilise, with full normalcy expected only between December 10 and 15. He added that the FDTL implementation relief has helped ease some pressure, but restoring complete schedules will still take several days as IndiGo works to recover from the meltdown.

title: Historic Modi‚ÄìPutin Meeting | India‚ÄìRussia  Economic Roadmap | Modi & Putin Discuss Trade, Defence
description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin is in New Delhi for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit, holding high-level talks with PM Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House. The leaders discussed defence, energy, labour, civil nuclear cooperation, and economic partnerships, while outlining a roadmap for India‚ÄìRussia trade and strategic cooperation until 2030. Putin assured India of uninterrupted energy supply and proposed trading in national currencies, while also offering small nuclear reactor technology. The summit highlights historic bilateral ties, agreements on Arctic, shipping, critical minerals, shipbuilding, and joint urea production, as both nations aim to strengthen cooperation across multiple sectors.

title: Indigo crisis results in domino-effect, Air India and other airlines also hit. Check details
description:
The Indian aviation sector is currently experiencing significant upheaval as IndiGo, one of the country's premium and largest air carriers, faces its fourth consecutive day of extensive flight disruptions. This crisis has not only affected thousands of IndiGo passengers but has also triggered a severe ripple effect, impacting the schedules and operations of other airlines, notably Air India and SpiceJet.

The scale of the disruption is substantial, with over 550 IndiGo flights cancelled or significantly delayed across the country. Specific reports highlight 191 cancellations in major hubs such as Delhi, Mumbai, Ahmedabad, and Hyderabad alone. Kolkata Airport also reported more than 20 cancellations and over 100 impacted flights. This widespread chaos has created a challenging environment at airports, overwhelming ground staff and leaving passengers in prolonged uncertainty.

title: Historic Modi‚ÄìPutin Meeting | India‚ÄìRussia  Economic Roadmap | Modi & Putin Discuss Trade, Defence
description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin is in New Delhi for the 23rd India-Russia Annual Summit, holding high-level talks with PM Narendra Modi at Hyderabad House. The leaders discussed defence, energy, labour, civil nuclear cooperation, and economic partnerships, while outlining a roadmap for India‚ÄìRussia trade and strategic cooperation until 2030. Putin assured India of uninterrupted energy supply and proposed trading in national currencies, while also offering small nuclear reactor technology. The summit highlights historic bilateral ties, agreements on Arctic, shipping, critical minerals, shipbuilding, and joint urea production, as both nations aim to strengthen cooperation across multiple sectors.

title: WhatsApp, Telegram May Stop Working If You Remove SIM - Here‚Äôs Why | SIM Binding | Digital Fraud
description:
India is planning a major shift in how messaging apps like WhatsApp, Telegram, Signal, Snapchat and others function, with a new SIM-binding rule that will tie app access directly to an active SIM card inside the phone. The government says this is crucial to curb cyber fraud, while telecom operators support it, but big tech platforms warn it could disrupt millions of users, break multi-device features, and push telecom rules into the app space. In this video, News9 explains what SIM binding means, how it will affect everyday users, why industry voices are divided, and what changes you may soon see in how you chat, work and log in across devices.

title: Delhi Drinking Water Risk | Uranium in Your Tap? | Groundwater Contamination Explained | News9
description:
Delhi‚Äôs water debate has taken a worrying turn, not for the usual reasons like pollution or shortages, but because uranium levels in parts of the city‚Äôs groundwater are rising. A new Central Ground Water Board survey found that 13‚Äì15% of Delhi‚Äôs samples showed elevated uranium, along with nitrate and fluoride in some pockets. Since the city relies heavily on tube wells, experts warn that long-term exposure could impact kidney health, especially for vulnerable groups. So where is this uranium coming from, how dangerous is it, and what needs to happen next? News9 breaks down the findings, health risks, and the urgent calls for better monitoring, filtration and transparency.

title: Putin India Visit: Russian President Vladimir Putin Arrives in India | News9
description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin is set to arrive in Delhi on Thursday evening for a two-day state visit to India, during which several agreements are expected to be signed between the two countries. The visit, extended at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, is Putin‚Äôs first trip to India since the launch of Russia‚Äôs war in Ukraine. This marks Putin‚Äôs first visit to India since 2021 and is being seen as historic, coinciding with the 25th anniversary of the India-Russia strategic partnership and the 23rd bilateral summit between the two countries. The leaders last met on September 1 in Tianjin during the SCO Summit and have held five phone conversations this year.
